title: Brussels Sprouts with Melted Leeks and Prosciutto

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings Brussels Sprouts with Melted Leeks and Prosciutto. Each serving comes out to be 177.25 Calories, 15.16g Fats, 3.64g Net Carbs, and 5.66g Protein.
instructions: 1. Wash the leeks thoroughly and slice thinly. Rinse sliced leeks in a fine mesh colander to remove any remaining grit.
2. Wash Brussels sprouts, then trim ends and halve.
3. Preheat a skillet over medium heat then add the ¼ cup of coconut oil to the pan. Once hot, cook leeks and sprouts until the leeks begin to brown.
4. Add the Prosciutto on top of the vegetables and cover the pan with a lid. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 10 additional minutes.
5. Mix the skillet together before serving.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings of Buffalo Coleslaw. Each serving comes out to be 179 Calories, 13.49g Fats, 5.46g Net Carbs, and 5.46g Protein.
ingredients: ½ large green cabbage, thinly sliced
½ medium white onion, finely diced
instructions: In a medium size bowl whisk together the mayonnaise, hot sauce, apple cider vinegar, garlic powder, and salt.
In a large mixing bowl toss together the green cabbage, celery, white onion, half the chives, and half the blue cheese.
Add the dressing to the cabbage and toss together.
Serve the coleslaw with a drizzle of hot sauce, and the remaining chives and blue cheese sprinkled on top.
Cook the cauliflower florets according to the package instructions.
Bring the cream to a simmer. Use a whisk to stir in the cream cheese and mix until smooth.
Stir in 6 ounces of the shredded cheddar cheese. Save the other 2 ounces for later. Mix until the cheese melts into the sauce.
Add the Dijon mustard, turmeric, powdered garlic, salt, and pepper. The sauce will become a smooth yellow color.
Make sure that the cauliflower is drained then add it to the cheese sauce. Evenly coat the florets with sauce.
Sprinkle on the remaining 2 ounces of cheddar cheese, then stir until mostly melted.
notes: This makes a total of 8 (3/4 cup) servings of Cauliflower Mac & Cheese. Each serving comes out to be 295.5 Calories, 25.38g Fats, 5.47g Net Carbs, and 10.63g Protein.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 8 servings of Cheesy Cauliflower Casserole Each serving comes out to be 135.13 Calories, 10.48g Fats, 4.47g Net Carbs, and 5.42g Protein.
instructions: Chop up your cauliflower into bite-size pieces, place it into a casserole dish.
Dice up your onions and add it to the cauliflower.
Pour in your sour cream and cheese into the dish.
Mix it all together!
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 (1-cup) servings of Creamy Keto Potato Salad. Each serving comes out to be 234.33 Calories, 19.53g Fat, 5.61g Net Carbs, and 7.69g Protein.
instructions: Prepare the cauliflower by cutting the head into bite sized florets and steaming in a silicone steamer (as shown) for 3-4 minutes or in a stovetop steamer until the cauliflower is only slightly tender. Set aside to cool.
Make the dressing by whisking together sour cream, mayo, vinegar, mustard, celery seed, and salt.
Mash the two reserved yolks into the cream mixture and whisk until very smooth.
Add the cooled cauliflower, boiled eggs, celery, onion and dill. Stir to coat.
Refrigerate for about 1 hour to allow the cauliflower to completely cool and the flavors to melt together. Garnish with green onion and serve cold!

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings of Crispy Zucchini Nests. Each serving comes out to be 130.83 Calories, 9.88g Fats, 4.27g Net Carbs, and 5.97g Protein.
instructions: Spiralize three zucchini with a spiral slicer.
Form the zucchini into 12 bunches on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Allow the zucchini to form it’s natural spiral shape.
Sprinkle garlic powder over all the nests.
Open up the middle of the nests and place the cheese, bacon, and onions inside.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes then broil for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the top of the zucchini has browned.
Take them out from the oven and serve with a scoop of sour cream on the top!

title: Fiesta Slaw with Avocado Lime Dressing

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings of Fiesta Slaw with Avocado Lime Dressing. Each serving comes out to be 365.5 Calories, 37.37g Fat, 4.49g Net Carbs, and 5.1g Protein.*If using a raw egg makes you uncomfortable, substitute with 1 cup Avocado Mayonnaise (or traditional mayonnaise) and omit oil. Keep in mind; this will change the fat content but not the carbohydrates and the dressing will be much thicker so thin with a bit of water if you’d like. If you have difficulty finding avocado oil, a mild olive oil will also work.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro, plus more to garnish
instructions: Cut the cabbage into thin strip or shred. Do the same for purple cabbage unless using pre-cut.
Cut the red bell pepper from end to end and remove stem and seeds. Slice or julienne the strips to desired thickness.
Combine the vegetables in a large bowl refrigerate while you prepare the dressing.
Add egg and oil into a tall, narrow jar or blender cup.
Slowly pour in lime juice, allowing the liquids to naturally settle.
Add chopped cilantro and spices to the blender cup or jar.

If using a stick blender (also known as immersion blender), begin by inserting the base into the bottom of the cup and turn on high. Keep the blade at the bottom of the cup and move back and forth gently. Once the mixture is well blended, slowly pull the base up and down until creamy.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently. Top with fresh cilantro.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings, 5 Garlic Parmesan Keto Croutons per serving. Each serving comes out to be 91 Calories, 7.25 g Fat, 1.53g Net Carbs, and 3.48 g Protein.
instructions: Heat oven to 350°F and line a baking sheet with parchment. Combine almond flour, psyllium fiber, baking powder, garlic and salt in a large mixing bowl and stir until uniform.
Add egg whites to the dry mixture and stir.
Work the dough with a spatula or your hands until it is a thick, slightly sticky consistently.
Divide dough into two balls and place on the parchment. They will already begin to become drier as you continue to work with them so move quickly!
Flatten each dough ball slightly and bake for 10 minutes or until the dough seems firm but not crusted on the edges.
Cut each portion in half, like a burger bun, and then each sliced into squares. This should yield about 9 croutons per section of dough.
Drizzle croutons with oil and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese then return to oven until the cheese has melted and browned.
Cool and serve on keto salads or soups!

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 40 tablespoon servings of Homemade Macadamia Nut Butter. Each serving comes out to be 93.55 Calories, 9.94g Fats, 0.59g Net Carbs, and 0.9g Protein.
instructions: Add 1lb. of macadamia nuts to your food processor and get them grinding.
As they grind, scrape the sides down to make sure everything continues to grind evenly.
After about 10 minutes of grinding, they will start to turn creamy.
Add your coconut oil and eryhtritol to the creamy macadamia nuts and continue to process them.
Once everything is combined and at the consistency you want, put it into a container and store in the fridge.

title: How To: Low Carb Candied Bacon

instructions: Coat bacon in erythritol.
Put in oven at 350F for 45-55 minutes.
Let cool for 10 minutes.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 8 servings of Keto Jalapeno Cornbread. Each serving comes out to be 301.93 Calories, 53.57g Fats, 2.96g Net Carbs, and 11.2g Protein.
ingredients: ½ cup full fat sour cream
½ cup grated sharp cheddar cheese
2 fresh jalapenos, seeded and membranes removed*
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F degrees. Prepare a mini loaf pan (8 loaves) by spraying with cooking spray or greasing with butter to prevent sticking.
In a large bowl whisk together the dry ingredients including the almond flour, golden flaxseed meal, baking powder and salt.
In a separate medium sized bowl whisk together the wet ingredients. Mix the wet and dry ingredients together then fold the diced pepper and grated cheddar cheese into the batter.
Spoon the batter evenly into the prepared loaf pan.Top each loaf with a pepper ring to garnish.
Bake for 20-22 minutes or until the loaves start to turn golden brown.
Cool the loaves in the pan for about 5 minutes and then remove to a wire rack to finish.
notes: *1 finely diced pepper and 1 cut into rings for garnish

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 4 servings of Roasted Broccoli Florets. Each serving comes out to be 62.25 Calories, 3.73g Fats, 3.89g Net Carbs, and 4.35g Protein.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400F.
Add broccoli and oil to Ziploc bag. Shake well.
Add spices and shake again.
Lay out broccoli on baking sheet, heads up. Bake 20-30 minutes.
Remove, let cool 5 minutes, and enjoy.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 8 servings Keto Bread Loaves. Each serving comes out to be 134.25 Calories, 8.32g Fats, 2.95g Net Carbs, and 8.21g Protein.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350F and grease pan(s). Then sift the coconut flour into a mixing bowl.
Add remaining dry ingredients and whisk.
Add eggs, water and vinegar.
Stir until batter comes together. It will be thick.
Press batter into pan(s) and bake until cooked through, about 40 minutes.
Allow bread to cool in pan until just warm, then remove from pan, slice and enjoy.

recipe.summary: In total, you will get 12 biscuits, each being 187.25 Calories, 15.98g Fats, 3.35g Net Carbs, and 7.99g Protein.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375F.
Measure our your broccoli and pulse it in the food processor until it is finely chopped.
Mix your almond flour and spices together, then add your eggs, vinegar, and coconut oil. Mix together well until a dough forms.
Mix your broccoli and shredded cheese into the mixture until well combined.
Measure out 12 patties from the dough and rest them on your silpat.
Bake the biscuits for 12-15 minutes, then take them out of the oven. Re-form them to look more biscuit like, then put them in the oven for 5 minutes more.
Turn your oven to broil and broil for an additional 4-5 minutes.
Let cool for 3-4 minutes, then remove from the silpat and cool on a cookie sheet for 5-10 minutes.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 10 servings of Loaded Cauliflower Salad. Each serving comes out to be 211.2 Calories, 19.6g Fats, 2.82g Net Carbs, and 4.92g Protein.
instructions: Chop up your cauliflower into bite-size pieces.
In a separate bowl, place your hard boiled and peeled eggs. Add in your mayonnaise to the eggs.
Top with the rest of your ingredients.
Mash with a fork until all your ingredients are mixed and your eggs are now crushed into small pieces.
Dump your sauce onto the cauliflower.
Mix thoroughly.
Top with a little more bacon and green onions.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings Irish Colcannon. Each serving comes out to be 179.33 Calories, 17.01g Fats, 3.32g Net Carbs, and 3.02g Protein.
ingredients: ½ cup sour cream, plus additional for topping
instructions: Combine cauliflower and spinach in a microwave safe bowl or a saucepan and cook until cauliflower is very tender, about 15 minutes.
Add cream, avocado, butter, sour cream and seasonings and blend with an immersion blender (or place carefully in your food processor and blend) until smooth.
Top with sour cream if desired and serve immediately.

title: Mashed Cauliflower with Parmesan Cheese and Truffle Oil

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 6 servings Mashed Cauliflower with Parmesan Cheese and Truffle Oil. Each serving comes out to be 111.83 Calories, 8.09g Fats, 2.77g Net Carbs, and 6.14g Protein.
ingredients: 1 pound cauliflower, cut into small florets or riced
¼ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
Optional: additional grated Parmesan cheese and parsley for garnish
instructions: Bring water to a boil in the lower part of a steamer. Place cauliflower in the upper part and salt with ¼ teaspoon salt, reserving the rest of the salt for later. Steam cauliflower until tender, about 7-10 minutes if using riced or 10-13 minutes if using small florets.
Transfer steamed cauliflower to a food processor. Add remaining ¼ teaspoon salt, butter, Parmesan cheese and black pepper. Process until smooth.
Add truffle oil and parsley to the food processor. Pulse a few times to chop and mix in the parsley leaves and incorporate the truffle oil
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with addition Parmesan cheese and parsley, if desired.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 4 servings of Spinach and Watercress Salad. Each serving comes out to be 203.75 Calories, 18.59 g Fat, 1.85 g Net Carbs, and 5.32 g Protein.
ingredients: 1 cup watercress, washed and stems removed
instructions: Prepare the greens by washing and removing the stems of the watercress and spinach. Pat dry.
Combine the spinach and watercress on a large serving platter or large bowl.
Cut your avocado in half and remove the pit. Peel the skin from each side.
Slice the avocado in thin strips and set aside for topping the salad.
To prepare the dressing, add the lemon juice to the avocado oil and Mediterranean seasoning. Shake well.
Add shredded Parmesan, avocado, salt, and pepper to the spinach. Drizzle with the dressing and serve.

recipe.summary: This makes a total of 4 servings Twice Baked Potato Style Zucchini. Each piece comes out to be 259.25 Calories, 19.64g Fats, 6.08g Net Carbs, and 7.31g Protein.
ingredients: 4 strips of no sugar added bacon, cooked, cooled and crumbled
2 ounces cream cheese, softened at room temperature
Optional garnish: jalapeno pepper slice and additional bacon crumbles
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F and have a small baking dish handy (no need to grease).

Wash and dry zucchini, cut it in half, then cut each half in half lengthwise. Use a spoon to scoop out most of the insides. Chop the scooped flesh and place in a bowl. Place the zucchini “boats” in the baking dish.
Add the remaining filling ingredients to the bowl and mash together to combine.
Divide mixture evenly between the 8 zucchini sections, filling them completely. Top with jalapeno slice and crumbled bacon, if desired.
Bake 30 minutes until filling bubbles and zucchini is becoming tender.
Remove from oven, cool 5 minutes, then transfer to serving plates.
